title: Animation Kikou: Marco Polo no Bouken
title_japanese: アニメーション紀行 マルコ・ポーロの冒険
synopsis: Seventeen-year-old Marco Polo leaves his home in Venice on a trip to the little-known country of "Yuan", in the company of his father Nicolo and his uncle Matteo. Their mission is to deliver the sacred oil from the Tomb of Christ and a letter from the Pope to the Kublai.
background:
This was an animated documentary on Marco Polo, mixed in with live-action footage. 43 episodes were broadcast on NHK from 1979 to 1980, but only the first and last episodes survive. While the cel animation was shot on film, post-production and editing were done on videotapes (normal for NHK programs), which have since been wiped.
(Source: Cartoon Research)
opening_themes: "Itsu no Hi ka Tabi Suru Mono yo (いつの日か旅する者よ)" by Kei Ogura
